chapter.p: “I am Yahweh and there is none besides me.

ul.li1: 19I have spoken not in secrecy, in a place, a land, of darkness,
ul.li2: I have not said to the descendants of Jacob, ‘Seek me in vain!’Literally “in emptiness,” as in verse 18
ul.li1: I, Yahweh, am speaking righteousness,
ul.li2: declaring uprightness.
ul.li1: 20Assemble and come;
ul.li2: draw near together, survivors of the nations!
They do not know, those who carry their wooden idolsLiterally “the wood of their idol”
and pray to a god who cannot save.
ul.li1: 21Declare and present your case,

ul.li1: Who made this knownLiterally “caused to hear this” from former times,Literally “before”

ul.li1: Was it not I, Yahweh?
ul.li2: And there is no other god besides me,
ul.li1: a righteous God besides me,
ul.li2: and no savior besides me.
ul.li1: 22Turn to me and be saved, all the ends of the earth,
ul.li2: for I am God and there is none besides me.
ul.li1: 23I have sworn by myself;
ul.li2: a word thatOr “and” shall not return has gone forth from my mouth in righteousness:
ul.li1: ‘Every knee shall kneel down to me;
ul.li2: every tongue shall swear.’
ul.li1: 24‘Only in Yahweh,’ one shall say to me, ‘are righteousness and strength.’
ul.li2: He shall come to him, and all those who were angry with him shall be ashamed.
ul.li1: 25In Yahweh all the offspring of Israel shall be in the right,
